title: How Artificial Intelligence is altering the nursing workforce
details: O Yakusheva, MJ Bouvier, COP Hagopian - Nursing Outlook, 2025
abstract: This paper focuses on the implications of Artificial Intelligence (AI) for the nursing workforce, examining both the opportunities presented by AI in relieving nurses of routine tasks and enabling better patient care, and the potential challenges it poses …

title: Direct Conditional Score Modeling for Accelerated MRI Reconstruction
abstract: Accelerated MRI reconstruction from undersampled k-space data is a crucial inverse problem for reducing scan times. Recent state-of-the-art methods for MRI reconstruction often employ diffusion-based generative models, but face challenges …

title: Deep Multi-contrast Cardiac MRI Reconstruction via vSHARP with Auxiliary Refinement Network
details: G Yiasemis, N Moriakov, JJ Sonke, J Teuwen - arXiv preprint arXiv:2411.01291, 2024
abstract: Cardiac MRI (CMRI) is a cornerstone imaging modality that provides in-depth insights into cardiac structure and function. Multi-contrast CMRI (MCCMRI), which acquires sequences with varying contrast weightings, significantly enhances …

title: Uncertainty Global Contrastive Learning Framework for Semi-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation
details: H Liu, P Ren, Y Yuan, C Song, F Luo - IEEE journal of biomedical and health informatics
abstract: In semi-supervised medical image segmentation, the issue of fuzzy boundaries for segmented objects arises. With limited labeled data and the interaction of boundaries from different segmented objects, classifying segmentation boundaries …
